duties_responsibilities.duty: Obtain comprehensive admission history, perform physical assessment, and demonstrate integrated assessment abilities.
Differentiate variations of normal and abnormal assessment findings, analyze and prioritize abnormal findings, and initiate appropriate response.
Anticipate actual or potential problems or health concerns in the hospital and/or home setting.
Demonstrate ongoing assessment of patient’s psychosocial, physiological, and educational process.
Integrate analysis of diagnostic information in patient assessment and care.
Formulate an individualized plan of care based on standards of care, practice, and hospital/unit policies.
Identify and focus on the physical, emotional, spiritual, cultural, learning, and discharge planning needs of the patient and significant other(s).
Develop, interpret, and correlate realistic goals and orders to maintain or improve patient health status.
Discuss and disseminate information concerning patient plan of care with members of the interdisciplinary health care team.
Participate in ongoing discharge planning with members of the interdisciplinary health care team.
Document all aspects of the nursing process in a legible, concise, clear, and timely manner utilizing appropriate hospital forms or technology and terminology.
Recognize patient’s readiness to learn, develop and enhance an individualized teaching plan.
Utilize available teaching materials and support groups, etc.; formulate instructional material as needed.
Evaluate patient’s responses to care and comprehension of education, monitor response to intervention and progress towards goals.
Demonstrate sound judgment with the Nursing Process based upon critical thinking skills and a problem-solving approach.
Organize, prioritize, and demonstrate accountability for nursing care, demonstrate sensitivity to strengths and limitations of peers.
Recognize own limitations, seek assistance, and take corrective action as needed.
Perform other related duties as assigned.
